member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateConnectionOnInterconnectRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AllocateConnectionOnInterconnect operation. Deprecated. Use AllocateHostedConnection instead.
Creates a hosted connection on an interconnect.
Allocates a VLAN number and a specified amount of bandwidth for use by a hosted connection on the specified interconnect.
Intended for use by Direct Connect Partners only.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateConnectionOnInterconnectRequest.Bandwidth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bandwidth.
The bandwidth of the connection. The possible values are 50Mbps, 100Mbps, 200Mbps, 300Mbps, 400Mbps, 500Mbps, 1Gbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps, and 10Gbps. Note that only those Direct Connect Partners who have met specific requirements are allowed to create a 1Gbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps or 10Gbps hosted connection.

member.summary:

The name of the provisioned connection.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The ID of the Amazon Web Services account of the customer for whom the connection will be provisioned.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateConnectionOnInterconnectResponse.ConnectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
The name of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateConnectionOnInterconnectResponse.ConnectionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionState.
The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:
ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateConnectionOnInterconnectResponse.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The MAC Security (MACsec) connection encryption mode.
The valid values are no_encrypt, should_encrypt, and must_encrypt.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateHostedConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AllocateHostedConnection operation. Creates a hosted connection on the specified interconnect or a link aggregation group (LAG) of interconnects.
Allocates a VLAN number and a specified amount of capacity (bandwidth) for use by a hosted connection on the specified interconnect or LAG of interconnects. Amazon Web Services polices the hosted connection for the specified capacity and the Direct Connect Partner must also police the hosted connection for the specified capacity.
Intended for use by Direct Connect Partners only.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateHostedConnectionRequest.Bandwidth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bandwidth.
The bandwidth of the connection. The possible values are 50Mbps, 100Mbps, 200Mbps, 300Mbps, 400Mbps, 500Mbps, 1Gbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps, and 10Gbps. Note that only those Direct Connect Partners who have met specific requirements are allowed to create a 1Gbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps or 10Gbps hosted connection.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AllocatePrivateVirtualInterface operation. Provisions a private virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Virtual interfaces created using this action must be confirmed by the owner using ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface. Until then, the virtual interface is in the Confirming state and is not available to handle traffic.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceId.
The ID of the virtual interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceName.
The name of the virtual interface assigned by the customer network. The name has a maximum of 100 characters. The following are valid characters: a-z, 0-9 and a hyphen (-).

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceState.
The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:
confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.
rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceType.
The type of virtual interface. The possible values are private and public.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.Vlan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Vlan.
The ID of the VLAN.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePublicVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AllocatePublicVirtualInterface operation. Provisions a public virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
The owner of a connection calls this function to provision a public virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Virtual interfaces created using this function must be confirmed by the owner using ConfirmPublicVirtualInterface. Until this step has been completed, the virtual interface is in the confirming state and is not available to handle traffic.
When creating an IPv6 public virtual interface, omit the Amazon address and customer address. IPv6 addresses are automatically assigned from the Amazon pool of IPv6 addresses; you cannot specify custom IPv6 addresses.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePublicVirtualInterfaceRequest.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the connection on which the public virtual interface is provisioned.

The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the public virtual interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePublicVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceState.
The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:
confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.
rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePublicVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceType.
The type of virtual interface. The possible values are private and public.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Vlan.
The ID of the VLAN.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateTransitVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AllocateTransitVirtualInterface operation. Provisions a transit virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account. Use this type of interface to connect a transit gateway to your Direct Connect gateway.
The owner of a connection provisions a transit virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
After you create a transit virtual interface, it must be confirmed by the owner using ConfirmTransitVirtualInterface. Until this step has been completed, the transit virtual interface is in the requested state and is not available to handle traffic.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateConnectionWithLagRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateConnectionWithLag operation. Associates an existing connection with a link aggregation group (LAG). The connection is interrupted and re-established as a member of the LAG (connectivity to Amazon Web Services is interrupted). The connection must be hosted on the same Direct Connect endpoint as the LAG, and its bandwidth must match the bandwidth for the LAG. You can re-associate a connection that's currently associated with a different LAG; however, if removing the connection would cause the original LAG to fall below its setting for minimum number of operational connections, the request fails.
Any virtual interfaces that are directly associated with the connection are automatically re-associated with the LAG. If the connection was originally associated with a different LAG, the virtual interfaces remain associated with the original LAG.
For interconnects, any hosted connections are automatically re-associated with the LAG. If the interconnect was originally associated with a different LAG, the hosted connections remain associated with the original LAG.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the connection.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LagId.
The ID of the LAG with which to associate the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateConnectionWithLagResponse.ConnectionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionState.
The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:
ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateHostedConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateHostedConnection operation. Associates a hosted connection and its virtual interfaces with a link aggregation group (LAG) or interconnect. If the target interconnect or LAG has an existing hosted connection with a conflicting VLAN number or IP address, the operation fails. This action temporarily interrupts the hosted connection's connectivity to Amazon Web Services as it is being migrated.
Intended for use by Direct Connect Partners only.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateMacSecKeyRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateMacSecKey operation. Associates a MAC Security (MACsec) Connection Key Name (CKN)/ Connectivity Association Key (CAK) pair with an Direct Connect dedicated connection.
You must supply either the secretARN, or the CKN/CAK (ckn and cak) pair in the request.
For information about MAC Security (MACsec) key considerations, see MACsec pre-shared CKN/CAK key considerations in the Direct Connect User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateMacSecKeyRequest.Cak
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Cak.
The MAC Security (MACsec) CAK to associate with the dedicated connection.
You can create the CKN/CAK pair using an industry standard tool.
The valid values are 64 hexadecimal characters (0-9, A-E).
If you use this request parameter, you must use the ckn request parameter and not use the secretARN request parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateMacSecKeyRequest.Ckn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ckn.
The MAC Security (MACsec) CKN to associate with the dedicated connection.
You can create the CKN/CAK pair using an industry standard tool.
The valid values are 64 hexadecimal characters (0-9, A-E).
If you use this request parameter, you must use the cak request parameter and not use the secretARN request parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateMacSecKeyRequest.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the dedicated connection (dxcon-xxxx), or the ID of the LAG (dxlag-xxxx).
You can use DescribeConnections or DescribeLags to retrieve connection ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateMacSecKeyRequest.SecretARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key to associate with the dedicated connection.
You can use DescribeConnections or DescribeLags to retrieve the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.
If you use this request parameter, you do not use the ckn and cak request parameters.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateVirtualInterface operation. Associates a virtual interface with a specified link aggregation group (LAG) or connection. Connectivity to Amazon Web Services is temporarily interrupted as the virtual interface is being migrated. If the target connection or LAG has an associated virtual interface with a conflicting VLAN number or a conflicting IP address, the operation fails.
Virtual interfaces associated with a hosted connection cannot be associated with a LAG; hosted connections must be migrated along with their virtual interfaces using AssociateHostedConnection.
To reassociate a virtual interface to a new connection or LAG, the requester must own either the virtual interface itself or the connection to which the virtual interface is currently associated. Additionally, the requester must own the connection or LAG for the association.

The ID of the LAG or connection.

The ID of the BGP peer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.BGPPeer.BgpPeerState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BgpPeerState.
The state of the BGP peer. The following are the possible values:
verifying: The BGP peering addresses or ASN require validation before the BGP peer can be created. This state applies only to public virtual interfaces.
pending: The BGP peer is created, and remains in this state until it is ready to be established.
available: The BGP peer is ready to be established.
deleting: The BGP peer is being deleted.
deleted: The BGP peer is deleted and cannot be established.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.BGPPeer.BgpStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BgpStatus.
The status of the BGP peer. The following are the possible values:
up: The BGP peer is established. This state does not indicate the state of the routing function. Ensure that you are receiving routes over the BGP session.
down: The BGP peer is down.
unknown: The BGP peer status is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.BGPPeer.CustomerAddress
member.summary:

The IP address assigned to the customer interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ConfirmConnection operation. Confirms the creation of the specified hosted connection on an interconnect.
Upon creation, the hosted connection is initially in the Ordering state, and remains in this state until the owner confirms creation of the hosted connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmConnectionRequest.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the hosted connection.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmConnectionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ConfirmConnection operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmConnectionResponse.ConnectionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionState.
The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:
ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface operation. Accepts ownership of a private virtual interface created by another Amazon Web Services account.
After the virtual interface owner makes this call, the virtual interface is created and attached to the specified virtual private gateway or Direct Connect gateway, and is made available to handle traffic.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest.DirectConnectGatewayId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DirectConnectGatewayId.
The ID of the Direct Connect gateway.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest.VirtualGatewayId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualGatewayId.
The ID of the virtual private gateway.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest.VirtualInterfaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceId.
The ID of the virtual interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceState.
The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:
confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.
rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateBGPPeerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateBGPPeer operation. Creates a BGP peer on the specified virtual interface.
You must create a BGP peer for the corresponding address family (IPv4/IPv6) in order to access Amazon Web Services resources that also use that address family.
If logical redundancy is not supported by the connection, interconnect, or LAG, the BGP peer cannot be in the same address family as an existing BGP peer on the virtual interface.
When creating a IPv6 BGP peer, omit the Amazon address and customer address. IPv6 addresses are automatically assigned from the Amazon pool of IPv6 addresses; you cannot specify custom IPv6 addresses.
For a public virtual interface, the Autonomous System Number (ASN) must be private or already on the allow list for the virtual interface.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NewBGPPeer.
Information about the BGP peer.

The virtual interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateConnection operation. Creates a connection between a customer network and a specific Direct Connect location.
A connection links your internal network to an Direct Connect location over a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an Direct Connect router.
To find the locations for your Region, use DescribeLocations.
You can automatically add the new connection to a link aggregation group (LAG) by specifying a LAG ID in the request. This ensures that the new connection is allocated on the same Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the specified LAG. If there are no available ports on the endpoint, the request fails and no connection is created.

member.summary:

MAC Security (MACsec) is only available on dedicated connections. For information about MAC Security (MACsec) prerequisties, see MACsec prerequisties in the Direct Connect User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateDirectConnectGatewayRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateDirectConnectGateway operation. Creates a Direct Connect gateway, which is an intermediate object that enables you to connect a set of virtual interfaces and virtual private gateways. A Direct Connect gateway is global and visible in any Amazon Web Services Region after it is created. The virtual interfaces and virtual private gateways that are connected through a Direct Connect gateway can be in different Amazon Web Services Regions. This enables you to connect to a VPC in any Region, regardless of the Region in which the virtual interfaces are located, and pass traffic between them.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateDirectConnectGatewayRequest.AmazonSideAsn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AmazonSideAsn.
The autonomous system number (ASN) for Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) to be configured on the Amazon side of the connection. The ASN must be in the private range of 64,512 to 65,534 or 4,200,000,000 to 4,294,967,294. The default is 64512.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateDirectConnectGatewayRequest.DirectConnectGatewayName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DirectConnectGatewayName.
The name of the Direct Connect gateway.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateDirectConnectGatewayResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateDirectConnectGateway operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateInterconnectRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateInterconnect operation. Creates an interconnect between an Direct Connect Partner's network and a specific Direct Connect location.
An interconnect is a connection that is capable of hosting other connections. The Direct Connect Partner can use an interconnect to provide Direct Connect hosted connections to customers through their own network services. Like a standard connection, an interconnect links the partner's network to an Direct Connect location over a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end is connected to the partner's router, the other to an Direct Connect router.
You can automatically add the new interconnect to a link aggregation group (LAG) by specifying a LAG ID in the request. This ensures that the new interconnect is allocated on the same Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the specified LAG. If there are no available ports on the endpoint, the request fails and no interconnect is created.
For each end customer, the Direct Connect Partner provisions a connection on their interconnect by calling AllocateHostedConnection. The end customer can then connect to Amazon Web Services resources by creating a virtual interface on their connection, using the VLAN assigned to them by the Direct Connect Partner.
Intended for use by Direct Connect Partners only.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateLagRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLag operation. Creates a link aggregation group (LAG) with the specified number of bundled physical dedicated connections between the customer network and a specific Direct Connect location. A LAG is a logical interface that uses the Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP) to aggregate multiple interfaces, enabling you to treat them as a single interface.
All connections in a LAG must use the same bandwidth (either 1Gbps or 10Gbps) and must terminate at the same Direct Connect endpoint.
You can have up to 10 dedicated connections per LAG. Regardless of this limit, if you request more connections for the LAG than Direct Connect can allocate on a single endpoint, no LAG is created.
You can specify an existing physical dedicated connection or interconnect to include in the LAG (which counts towards the total number of connections). Doing so interrupts the current physical dedicated connection, and re-establishes them as a member of the LAG. The LAG will be created on the same Direct Connect endpoint to which the dedicated connection terminates. Any virtual interfaces associated with the dedicated connection are automatically disassociated and re-associated with the LAG. The connection ID does not change.
If the Amazon Web Services account used to create a LAG is a registered Direct Connect Partner, the LAG is automatically enabled to host sub-connections. For a LAG owned by a partner, any associated virtual interfaces cannot be directly configured.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreatePrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreatePrivateVirtualInterface operation. Creates a private virtual interface. A virtual interface is the VLAN that transports Direct Connect traffic. A private virtual interface can be connected to either a Direct Connect gateway or a Virtual Private Gateway (VGW). Connecting the private virtual interface to a Direct Connect gateway enables the possibility for connecting to multiple VPCs, including VPCs in different Amazon Web Services Regions. Connecting the private virtual interface to a VGW only provides access to a single VPC within the same Region.
Setting the MTU of a virtual interface to 9001 (jumbo frames) can cause an update to the underlying physical connection if it wasn't updated to support jumbo frames. Updating the connection disrupts network connectivity for all virtual interfaces associated with the connection for up to 30 seconds. To check whether your connection supports jumbo frames, call DescribeConnections. To check whether your virtual interface supports jumbo frames, call DescribeVirtualInterfaces.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceState.
The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:
confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.
rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreatePrivateVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceType.
The type of virtual interface. The possible values are private and public.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Vlan.
The ID of the VLAN.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreatePublicVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreatePublicVirtualInterface operation. Creates a public virtual interface. A virtual interface is the VLAN that transports Direct Connect traffic. A public virtual interface supports sending traffic to public services of Amazon Web Services such as Amazon S3.
When creating an IPv6 public virtual interface (addressFamily is ipv6), leave the customer and amazon address fields blank to use auto-assigned IPv6 space. Custom IPv6 addresses are not supported.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateTransitVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateTransitVirtualInterface operation. Creates a transit virtual interface. A transit virtual interface should be used to access one or more transit gateways associated with Direct Connect gateways. A transit virtual interface enables the connection of multiple VPCs attached to a transit gateway to a Direct Connect gateway.
If you associate your transit gateway with one or more Direct Connect gateways, the Autonomous System Number (ASN) used by the transit gateway and the Direct Connect gateway must be different. For example, if you use the default ASN 64512 for both your the transit gateway and Direct Connect gateway, the association request fails.
Setting the MTU of a virtual interface to 8500 (jumbo frames) can cause an update to the underlying physical connection if it wasn't updated to support jumbo frames. Updating the connection disrupts network connectivity for all virtual interfaces associated with the connection for up to 30 seconds. To check whether your connection supports jumbo frames, call DescribeConnections. To check whether your virtual interface supports jumbo frames, call DescribeVirtualInterfaces.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateTransitVirtualInterfaceRequest.ConnectionId
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DeleteConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteConnection operation. Deletes the specified connection.
Deleting a connection only stops the Direct Connect port hour and data transfer charges. If you are partnering with any third parties to connect with the Direct Connect location, you must cancel your service with them separately.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DeleteConnectionResponse.ConnectionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionState.
The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:
ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

requested: The initial state of an interconnect. The interconnect stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DeleteVirtualInterfaceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteVirtualInterface operation. Deletes a virtual interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DeleteVirtualInterfaceRequest.VirtualInterfaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceId.
The ID of the virtual interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DeleteVirtualInterfaceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteVirtualInterface operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DeleteVirtualInterfaceResponse.VirtualInterfaceState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceState.
The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:
confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.
rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DescribeConnectionLoaRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeConnectionLoa operation. Deprecated. Use DescribeLoa instead.
Gets the LOA-CFA for a connection.
The Letter of Authorization - Connecting Facility Assignment (LOA-CFA) is a document that your APN partner or service provider uses when establishing your cross connect to Amazon Web Services at the colocation facility. For more information, see Requesting Cross Connects at Direct Connect Locations in the Direct Connect User Guide.

The standard media type for the LOA-CFA document. The only supported value is application/pdf.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderName.
The name of the APN partner or service provider who establishes connectivity on your behalf. If you specify this parameter, the LOA-CFA lists the provider name alongside your company name as the requester of the cross connect.

member.summary:

The type of network-to-network interface (NNI) partner. The partner type will be one of the following:
V1: This partner can only allocate 50Mbps, 100Mbps, 200Mbps, 300Mbps, 400Mbps, or 500Mbps subgigabit connections.
V2: This partner can only allocate 1GB, 2GB, 5GB, or 10GB hosted connections.
nonPartner: The customer is not a partner.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DescribeDirectConnectGatewayAssociationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeDirectConnectGatewayAssociations operation. Lists the associations between your Direct Connect gateways and virtual private gateways and transit gateways. You must specify one of the following:
A Direct Connect gateway
The response contains all virtual private gateways and transit gateways associated with the Direct Connect gateway.
A virtual private gateway
The response contains the Direct Connect gateway.
A transit gateway
The response contains the Direct Connect gateway.
A Direct Connect gateway and a virtual private gateway
The response contains the association between the Direct Connect gateway and virtual private gateway.
A Direct Connect gateway and a transit gateway
The response contains the association between the Direct Connect gateway and transit gateway.

The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeDirectConnectGatewayAttachments operation. Lists the attachments between your Direct Connect gateways and virtual interfaces. You must specify a Direct Connect gateway, a virtual interface, or both. If you specify a Direct Connect gateway, the response contains all virtual interfaces attached to the Direct Connect gateway. If you specify a virtual interface, the response contains all Direct Connect gateways attached to the virtual interface. If you specify both, the response contains the attachment between the Direct Connect gateway and the virtual interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DisassociateConnectionFromLag operation. Disassociates a connection from a link aggregation group (LAG). The connection is interrupted and re-established as a standalone connection (the connection is not deleted; to delete the connection, use the DeleteConnection request). If the LAG has associated virtual interfaces or hosted connections, they remain associated with the LAG. A disassociated connection owned by an Direct Connect Partner is automatically converted to an interconnect.
If disassociating the connection would cause the LAG to fall below its setting for minimum number of operational connections, the request fails, except when it's the last member of the LAG. If all connections are disassociated, the LAG continues to exist as an empty LAG with no physical connections.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagRequest.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagRequest.LagId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LagId.
The ID of the LAG.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse
member.summary: Information about an Direct Connect connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.AwsDevice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDevice.
The Direct Connect endpoint on which the physical connection terminates.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.AwsDeviceV2
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDeviceV2.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.AwsLogicalDeviceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsLogicalDeviceId.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.Bandwidth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bandwidth.
The bandwidth of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.ConnectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
The name of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.ConnectionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionState.
The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:
ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The MAC Security (MACsec) connection encryption mode.
The valid values are no_encrypt, should_encrypt, and must_encrypt.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HasLogicalRedundancy.
Indicates whether the connection supports a secondary BGP peer in the same address family (IPv4/IPv6).

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JumboFrameCapable.
Indicates whether jumbo frames (9001 MTU) are supported.

member.summary:

The ID of the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateConnectionFromLagResponse.PortEncryptionStatus
member.summary:

The MAC Security (MACsec) port link status of the connection.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateMacSecKeyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DisassociateMacSecKey operation. Removes the association between a MAC Security (MACsec) security key and an Direct Connect dedicated connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateMacSecKeyRequest.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the dedicated connection (dxcon-xxxx), or the ID of the LAG (dxlag-xxxx).
You can use DescribeConnections or DescribeLags to retrieve connection ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.DisassociateMacSecKeyRequest.SecretARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.
You can use DescribeConnections to retrieve the ARN of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect
member.summary: Information about an interconnect.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.AwsDevice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDevice.
The Direct Connect endpoint on which the physical connection terminates.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.AwsDeviceV2
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDeviceV2.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.AwsLogicalDeviceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsLogicalDeviceId.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.Bandwidth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bandwidth.
The bandwidth of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.HasLogicalRedundancy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HasLogicalRedundancy.
Indicates whether the interconnect supports a secondary BGP in the same address family (IPv4/IPv6).

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.InterconnectId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InterconnectId.
The ID of the interconnect.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.InterconnectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InterconnectName.
The name of the interconnect.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.InterconnectState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InterconnectState.
The state of the interconnect. The following are the possible values:
requested: The initial state of an interconnect. The interconnect stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The interconnect is approved, and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up, and the interconnect is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The interconnect is being deleted.
deleted: The interconnect is deleted.
unknown: The state of the interconnect is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.JumboFrameCapable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JumboFrameCapable.
Indicates whether jumbo frames (9001 MTU) are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.LagId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LagId.
The ID of the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Interconnect.LoaIssueTime
member.summary:

The time of the most recent call to DescribeLoa for this connection.

The location of the connection.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag
member.summary: Information about a link aggregation group (LAG).

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.AllowsHostedConnections
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowsHostedConnections.
Indicates whether the LAG can host other connections.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.AwsDevice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDevice.
The Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.AwsDeviceV2
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDeviceV2.
The Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.AwsLogicalDeviceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsLogicalDeviceId.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.Connections
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Connections.
The connections bundled by the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.ConnectionsBandwidth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionsBandwidth.
The individual bandwidth of the physical connections bundled by the LAG. The possible values are 1Gbps and 10Gbps.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The LAG MAC Security (MACsec) encryption mode.
The valid values are no_encrypt, should_encrypt, and must_encrypt.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.HasLogicalRedundancy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HasLogicalRedundancy.
Indicates whether the LAG supports a secondary BGP peer in the same address family (IPv4/IPv6).

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.JumboFrameCapable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JumboFrameCapable.
Indicates whether jumbo frames (9001 MTU) are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.LagId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LagId.
The ID of the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.LagName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LagName.
The name of the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.LagState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LagState.
The state of the LAG. The following are the possible values:
requested: The initial state of a LAG. The LAG stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is available.
pending: The LAG has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is established and the LAG is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The LAG is being deleted.
deleted: The LAG is deleted.
unknown: The state of the LAG is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
The location of the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.MacSecCapable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MacSecCapable.
Indicates whether the LAG supports MAC Security (MACsec).

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.MacSecKeys
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MacSecKeys.
The MAC Security (MACsec) security keys associated with the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.MinimumLinks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinimumLinks.
The minimum number of physical dedicated connections that must be operational for the LAG itself to be operational.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.NumberOfConnections
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfConnections.
The number of physical dedicated connections bundled by the LAG, up to a maximum of 10.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.OwnerAccount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OwnerAccount.
The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.ProviderName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderName.
The name of the service provider associated with the LAG.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The Amazon Web Services Region where the connection is located.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Lag.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags associated with the LAG.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistory operation. Lists the virtual interface failover test history.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest.BgpPeers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BgpPeers.
The BGP peers that were placed in the DOWN state during the virtual interface failover test.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.
If MaxResults is given a value larger than 100, only 100 results are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token for the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the virtual interface failover test.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest.TestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestId.
The ID of the virtual interface failover test.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryRequest.VirtualInterfaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceId.
The ID of the virtual interface that was tested.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistory operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistoryResponse.VirtualInterfaceTestHistory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceTestHistory.
The ID of the tested virtual interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Loa
member.summary: Information about a Letter of Authorization - Connecting Facility Assignment (LOA-CFA) for a connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Loa.LoaContent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoaContent.
The binary contents of the LOA-CFA document.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Loa.LoaContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoaContentType.
The standard media type for the LOA-CFA document. The only supported value is application/pdf.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location
member.summary: Information about an Direct Connect location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location.AvailableMacSecPortSpeeds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailableMacSecPortSpeeds.
The available MAC Security (MACsec) port speeds for the location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location.AvailablePortSpeeds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailablePortSpeeds.
The available port speeds for the location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location.AvailableProviders
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailableProviders.
The name of the service provider for the location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location.LocationCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationCode.
The code for the location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location.LocationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationName.
The name of the location. This includes the name of the colocation partner and the physical site of the building.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.Location.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The Amazon Web Services Region for the location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.MacSecKey
member.summary: Information about the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.MacSecKey.Ckn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ckn.
The Connection Key Name (CKN) for the MAC Security secret key.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.MacSecKey.SecretARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.MacSecKey.StartOn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartOn.
The date that the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key takes effect. The value is displayed in UTC format.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.MacSecKey.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The state of the MAC Security (MACsec) secret key.
The possible values are:
associating: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is being validated and not yet associated with the connection or LAG.
associated: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is validated and associated with the connection or LAG.
disassociating: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is being disassociated from the connection or LAG
disassociated: The MAC Security (MACsec) secret key is no longer associated with the connection or LAG.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.StartBgpFailoverTestRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartBgpFailoverTest operation. Starts the virtual interface failover test that verifies your configuration meets your resiliency requirements by placing the BGP peering session in the DOWN state. You can then send traffic to verify that there are no outages.
You can run the test on public, private, transit, and hosted virtual interfaces.
You can use ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistory to view the virtual interface test history.
If you need to stop the test before the test interval completes, use StopBgpFailoverTest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.StartBgpFailoverTestRequest.BgpPeers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BgpPeers.
The BGP peers to place in the DOWN state.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.StartBgpFailoverTestRequest.TestDurationInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestDurationInMinutes.
The time in minutes that the virtual interface failover test will last.
Maximum value: 180 minutes (3 hours).
Default: 180 minutes (3 hours).

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.StartBgpFailoverTestRequest.VirtualInterfaceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceId.
The ID of the virtual interface you want to test.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.StartBgpFailoverTestResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartBgpFailoverTest operation.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceTest.
Information about the virtual interface failover test.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateConnection operation. Updates the Direct Connect dedicated connection configuration.
You can update the following parameters for a connection:
The connection name
The connection's MAC Security (MACsec) encryption mode.

member.summary:

The ID of the dedicated connection.
You can use DescribeConnections to retrieve the connection ID.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
The name of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionRequest.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The connection MAC Security (MACsec) encryption mode.
The valid values are no_encrypt, should_encrypt, and must_encrypt.

member.summary: Information about an Direct Connect connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.AwsDevice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDevice.
The Direct Connect endpoint on which the physical connection terminates.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.AwsDeviceV2
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsDeviceV2.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.AwsLogicalDeviceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AwsLogicalDeviceId.
The Direct Connect endpoint that terminates the logical connection. This device might be different than the device that terminates the physical connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.Bandwidth
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bandwidth.
The bandwidth of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.ConnectionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionId.
The ID of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.ConnectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
The name of the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.ConnectionState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionState.
The state of the connection. The following are the possible values:
ordering: The initial state of a hosted connection provisioned on an interconnect. The connection stays in the ordering state until the owner of the hosted connection confirms or declines the connection order.
requested: The initial state of a standard connection. The connection stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is sent to the customer.
pending: The connection has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is up and the connection is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The connection is being deleted.
deleted: The connection has been deleted.
rejected: A hosted connection in the ordering state enters the rejected state if it is deleted by the customer.
unknown: The state of the connection is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The MAC Security (MACsec) connection encryption mode.
The valid values are no_encrypt, should_encrypt, and must_encrypt.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateConnectionResponse.HasLogicalRedundancy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HasLogicalRedundancy.
Indicates whether the connection supports a secondary BGP peer in the same address family (IPv4/IPv6).

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateLagRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLag operation. Updates the attributes of the specified link aggregation group (LAG).
You can update the following LAG attributes:
The name of the LAG.
The value for the minimum number of connections that must be operational for the LAG itself to be operational.
The LAG's MACsec encryption mode.
Amazon Web Services assigns this value to each connection which is part of the LAG.
The tags
If you adjust the threshold value for the minimum number of operational connections, ensure that the new value does not cause the LAG to fall below the threshold and become non-operational.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateLagRequest.EncryptionMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionMode.
The LAG MAC Security (MACsec) encryption mode.
Amazon Web Services applies the value to all connections which are part of the LAG.

member.summary:

The state of the LAG. The following are the possible values:
requested: The initial state of a LAG. The LAG stays in the requested state until the Letter of Authorization (LOA) is available.
pending: The LAG has been approved and is being initialized.
available: The network link is established and the LAG is ready for use.
down: The network link is down.
deleting: The LAG is being deleted.
deleted: The LAG is deleted.
unknown: The state of the LAG is not available.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributes operation. Updates the specified attributes of the specified virtual private interface.
Setting the MTU of a virtual interface to 9001 (jumbo frames) can cause an update to the underlying physical connection if it wasn't updated to support jumbo frames. Updating the connection disrupts network connectivity for all virtual interfaces associated with the connection for up to 30 seconds. To check whether your connection supports jumbo frames, call DescribeConnections. To check whether your virtual q interface supports jumbo frames, call DescribeVirtualInterfaces.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributesRequest.Mtu
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributesResponse.VirtualInterfaceName
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributesResponse.VirtualInterfaceState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceState.
The state of the virtual interface. The following are the possible values:
confirming: The creation of the virtual interface is pending confirmation from the virtual interface owner. If the owner of the virtual interface is different from the owner of the connection on which it is provisioned, then the virtual interface will remain in this state until it is confirmed by the virtual interface owner.
verifying: This state only applies to public virtual interfaces. Each public virtual interface needs validation before the virtual interface can be created.
pending: A virtual interface is in this state from the time that it is created until the virtual interface is ready to forward traffic.
available: A virtual interface that is able to forward traffic.
down: A virtual interface that is BGP down.
deleting: A virtual interface is in this state immediately after calling DeleteVirtualInterface until it can no longer forward traffic.
deleted: A virtual interface that cannot forward traffic.
rejected: The virtual interface owner has declined creation of the virtual interface. If a virtual interface in the Confirming state is deleted by the virtual interface owner, the virtual interface enters the Rejected state.
unknown: The state of the virtual interface is not available.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributesResponse.VirtualInterfaceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualInterfaceType.
The type of virtual interface. The possible values are private and public.

member.name: P:Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.UpdateVirtualInterfaceAttributesResponse.Vlan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Vlan.
The ID of the VLAN.

deleted: The virtual private gateway is deleted. The private virtual interface is unable to send traffic over this gateway.

member.name: T:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing DirectConnect
Direct Connect links your internal network to an Direct Connect location over a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an Direct Connect router. With this connection in place, you can create virtual interfaces directly to the Amazon Web Services Cloud (for example, to Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3) and to Amazon VPC, bypassing Internet service providers in your network path. A connection provides access to all Amazon Web Services Regions except the China (Beijing) and (China) Ningxia Regions. Amazon Web Services resources in the China Regions can only be accessed through locations associated with those Regions.

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDirectConnectClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.AllocateHostedConnection(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocateHostedConnectionRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a hosted connection on the specified interconnect or a link aggregation group (LAG) of interconnects.
Allocates a VLAN number and a specified amount of capacity (bandwidth) for use by a hosted connection on the specified interconnect or LAG of interconnects. Amazon Web Services polices the hosted connection for the specified capacity and the Direct Connect Partner must also police the hosted connection for the specified capacity.
Intended for use by Direct Connect Partners only.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AllocateHostedConnection service method.
member.returns: The response from the AllocateHostedConnection service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
member.exception: One or more parameters are not valid.
A server-side error occurred.
A tag key was specified more than once.
You have reached the limit on the number of tags that can be assigned.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for AllocateHostedConnection Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterface(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePrivateVirtualInterfaceRequest)
member.summary:
Provisions a private virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Virtual interfaces created using this action must be confirmed by the owner using ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface. Until then, the virtual interface is in the Confirming state and is not available to handle traffic.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AllocatePrivateVirtualInterface service method.
member.returns: The response from the AllocatePrivateVirtualInterface service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
member.exception: One or more parameters are not valid.
A server-side error occurred.
A tag key was specified more than once.
You have reached the limit on the number of tags that can be assigned.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for AllocatePrivateVirtualInterface Operation

member.summary:
Provisions a private virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Virtual interfaces created using this action must be confirmed by the owner using ConfirmPrivateVirtualInterface. Until then, the virtual interface is in the Confirming state and is not available to handle traffic.

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.AllocatePublicVirtualInterface(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AllocatePublicVirtualInterfaceRequest)
member.summary:
Provisions a public virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
The owner of a connection calls this function to provision a public virtual interface to be owned by the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Virtual interfaces created using this function must be confirmed by the owner using ConfirmPublicVirtualInterface. Until this step has been completed, the virtual interface is in the confirming state and is not available to handle traffic.
When creating an IPv6 public virtual interface, omit the Amazon address and customer address. IPv6 addresses are automatically assigned from the Amazon pool of IPv6 addresses; you cannot specify custom IPv6 addresses.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AllocatePublicVirtualInterface service method.
member.returns: The response from the AllocatePublicVirtualInterface service method, as returned by DirectConnect.

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.AssociateConnectionWithLag(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateConnectionWithLagRequest)
member.summary:
Associates an existing connection with a link aggregation group (LAG). The connection is interrupted and re-established as a member of the LAG (connectivity to Amazon Web Services is interrupted). The connection must be hosted on the same Direct Connect endpoint as the LAG, and its bandwidth must match the bandwidth for the LAG. You can re-associate a connection that's currently associated with a different LAG; however, if removing the connection would cause the original LAG to fall below its setting for minimum number of operational connections, the request fails.
Any virtual interfaces that are directly associated with the connection are automatically re-associated with the LAG. If the connection was originally associated with a different LAG, the virtual interfaces remain associated with the original LAG.
For interconnects, any hosted connections are automatically re-associated with the LAG. If the interconnect was originally associated with a different LAG, the hosted connections remain associated with the original LAG.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AssociateConnectionWithLag service method.
member.returns: The response from the AssociateConnectionWithLag service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
member.exception: One or more parameters are not valid.
A server-side error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for AssociateConnectionWithLag Operation

For interconnects, any hosted connections are automatically re-associated with the LAG. If the interconnect was originally associated with a different LAG, the hosted connections remain associated with the original LAG.

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.AssociateHostedConnection(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateHostedConnectionRequest)
member.summary:
Associates a hosted connection and its virtual interfaces with a link aggregation group (LAG) or interconnect. If the target interconnect or LAG has an existing hosted connection with a conflicting VLAN number or IP address, the operation fails. This action temporarily interrupts the hosted connection's connectivity to Amazon Web Services as it is being migrated.
Intended for use by Direct Connect Partners only.

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.AssociateVirtualInterface(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.AssociateVirtualInterfaceRequest)
member.summary:
Associates a virtual interface with a specified link aggregation group (LAG) or connection. Connectivity to Amazon Web Services is temporarily interrupted as the virtual interface is being migrated. If the target connection or LAG has an associated virtual interface with a conflicting VLAN number or a conflicting IP address, the operation fails.
Virtual interfaces associated with a hosted connection cannot be associated with a LAG; hosted connections must be migrated along with their virtual interfaces using AssociateHostedConnection.
To reassociate a virtual interface to a new connection or LAG, the requester must own either the virtual interface itself or the connection to which the virtual interface is currently associated. Additionally, the requester must own the connection or LAG for the association.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AssociateVirtualInterface service method.
member.returns: The response from the AssociateVirtualInterface service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
member.exception: One or more parameters are not valid.
A server-side error occurred.

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.CreateBGPPeer(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateBGPPeerRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a BGP peer on the specified virtual interface.
You must create a BGP peer for the corresponding address family (IPv4/IPv6) in order to access Amazon Web Services resources that also use that address family.
If logical redundancy is not supported by the connection, interconnect, or LAG, the BGP peer cannot be in the same address family as an existing BGP peer on the virtual interface.
When creating a IPv6 BGP peer, omit the Amazon address and customer address. IPv6 addresses are automatically assigned from the Amazon pool of IPv6 addresses; you cannot specify custom IPv6 addresses.
For a public virtual interface, the Autonomous System Number (ASN) must be private or already on the allow list for the virtual interface.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateBGPPeer service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateBGPPeer service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
member.exception: One or more parameters are not valid.
A server-side error occurred.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateBGPPeer Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.CreateConnection(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateConnectionRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a connection between a customer network and a specific Direct Connect location.
A connection links your internal network to an Direct Connect location over a standard Ethernet fiber-optic cable. One end of the cable is connected to your router, the other to an Direct Connect router.
To find the locations for your Region, use DescribeLocations.
You can automatically add the new connection to a link aggregation group (LAG) by specifying a LAG ID in the request. This ensures that the new connection is allocated on the same Direct Connect endpoint that hosts the specified LAG. If there are no available ports on the endpoint, the request fails and no connection is created.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateConnection service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateConnection service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
member.exception: One or more parameters are not valid.
A server-side error occurred.
A tag key was specified more than once.
You have reached the limit on the number of tags that can be assigned.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateConnection Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.DirectConnect.AmazonDirectConnectClient.CreateDirectConnectGateway(Amazon.DirectConnect.Model.CreateDirectConnectGatewayRequest)
member.summary: Creates a Direct Connect gateway, which is an intermediate object that enables you to connect a set of virtual interfaces and virtual private gateways. A Direct Connect gateway is global and visible in any Amazon Web Services Region after it is created. The virtual interfaces and virtual private gateways that are connected through a Direct Connect gateway can be in different Amazon Web Services Regions. This enables you to connect to a VPC in any Region, regardless of the Region in which the virtual interfaces are located, and pass traffic between them.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateDirectConnectGateway service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateDirectConnectGateway service method, as returned by DirectConnect.
